name: Software Engineer / Java (Customer Solutions Team)
description:
We are looking for an experienced Software Engineer (Java) to join our GridGain Customer Solutions department to work with the new company direction — GridGain Nebula MSO.

Who we are

GridGain Systems is a major contributor to the Apache Ignite™ — a TOP-5 Apache SF project, an open-source distributed database and in-memory computing platform which is used in companies all over the world for fast and fault-tolerant access to their data.

GridGain’s Customer Solutions team is responsible for helping GridGain’s users like American Express, Barclays, Microsoft, IBM, American Airlines and many more integrate and use Apache Ignite™ platform to build and launch their products.

GridGain Nebula is a Managed Services Offering for Apache Ignite™ and GridGain. It helps our customer's organization to focus on developing applications based on GridGain or Apache Ignite™ without the need for an internal software development team to manage their in-memory computing environment. The GridGain Nebula team applies our best practices and tools backed by decades of experience to maximize the availability of your in-memory computing applications.

What you will do

As part of the GridGain Nebula team, you will:

  • Assist the dedicated GridGain Nebula support team with troubleshooting and providing architecture and usage guidelines.
  • Run pilot projects: build proof-of-concept systems to meet architectural, performance and other requirements of potential customers.
  • Work to automate deployment and management processes for various public cloud providers such as AWS, GCE, AZURE.
  • Help to design and implement new features and influence the product direction based on the customer feedback
  • Develop the platform, integrations with different technologies and tools

What we expect

  • 1+ years experience as a Software Engineer
  • Java knowledge (Core Libraries, Garbage Collector, IO, JVM internals)
  • Understanding of the concurrent programming
  • Understanding with SQL databases
  • English — upper intermediate or higher
  • Readiness to schedule - 1 full working day (24h) / 3 days off

The following will be a strong plus:

  • Experience with Docker or public Cloud (AWS, GCE, Azure, etc.)
  • Experience with automation tools for public cloud deployment (ansible, terraform, etc.)
  • Experience in supporting Linux systems (iptables, firewalld, selinux)
  • Experience working in support, consulting or other customer-facing positions
  • Experience in troubleshooting Java applications and/or databases
  • Experience of network configuration (static routing, subnets, gateways)

What is cool about this job

  • Working in a team of very skilled engineers on a bleeding-edge product — the opportunity to learn from highly professional colleagues and intensive self-development are guaranteed
  • Solving real-world problems every day — world’s largest companies will rely on you to run their business, and you will always see the impact of your work
  • Being a part of the open-source community: you can participate in the development and discussions, become an Apache Foundation committer or try yourself as a speaker
  • Benefits package: stock options, medical insurance, gym membership compensation, English classes
  • We encourage our engineers to speak on conferences, webinars and meetups or write blogs about Apache Ignite™ and GridGain
  • Friendly atmosphere, team work, corporate events. We welcome the comprehensive development, love of music and other types of arts

Welcome to GridGain Team!
